definition: clock/o'clock/time as measured in hours and minutes/bell/CL:架[jia4],座[zuo4]
handleless cup/goblet/to concentrate/variant of 鐘|钟[zhong1]
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The play ball for 1 hour every day.
sentences.chinese: 他们打球打了一个钟头每天。

sentences.english: I'll come walking with you in an hour or so.
sentences.chinese: 我大约一个钟头以后就来陪你散步。

sentences.english: Try to pacify the child, he's been crying for hours.
sentences.chinese: 快哄哄孩子，他哭了好几个钟头了。

sentences.english: The chairman dispatched the meeting in half an hour.
sentences.chinese: 主席在半个钟头内就把会议迅速开完。

sentences.english: They dickered for hours over some of the details of the agreement.
sentences.chinese: 他们就协议的某些细节讨价还价了好几钟头。

sentences.english: There's nothing to do here; let's go into that field and knock a ball about for an hour or so.
sentences.chinese: 这里无事可做，咱们去那个场子打一个来钟头的球吧。

sentences.english: The meet wa schedul for two hours, but it is now over yet.
sentences.chinese: 会议原定了两个钟头，不过现在尚无竣事。

sentences.english: Duringthe three-hour flight, I vomited five times.
sentences.chinese: 三个钟头的飞程中，我共吐了五次。

sentences.english: It took them nearly three hours to get in all the money.
sentences.chinese: 他们几乎花了三个钟头才把钱收齐。

sentences.english: Your twenty leagues all at a full trot, and in less than eight hours.
sentences.chinese: 您那二十法里，一路小跑，不到八个钟头便到了。

sentences.english: Their guest did not protract his stay that evening above an hour longer.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上他们的客人逗留不到一个钟头。

sentences.english: The children have been wanting me this half hour. ---Your's, very sincerely, M. GARDINER.
sentences.chinese: 我无法再写下去，孩子们已经嚷着要我要了半个钟头。

sentences.english: He began two hours ago. He ought to have finished filling in the forms now.
sentences.chinese: 两个钟头前他就开始了，现在应该填完那些表格了。

sentences.english: It's a two-to-three-hour drive on the highway.
sentences.chinese: 走高速公路要开两到三个钟头。

sentences.english: The plane was held up for one hour because of a snowstorm.
sentences.chinese: 暴风雪使飞机推迟了一个钟头。

sentences.english: It was about an hour later that the geese woke up. They had devastating hangovers.
sentences.chinese: 约莫一个钟头以后这些鹅醒了，宿醉得要死不活。

definition: spirit weary, strength exhausted (idiom); spent/drained/washed out
a moment/a while/in a moment/now...now.../also pr. [yi1 hui3 r5]
tired to the point of dropping
body weary, strength exhausted (idiom); extremely tired/spent
to stop work for the day (generally of laborers)/to knock off
